sprint_stories.title: As a content operations user, I want an admin interface to review and approve scraped smartphone data so that data accuracy and quality is ensured before publishing
sprint_stories.description: Develop the content operations admin-forge page enabling content teams to view, edit, and approve scraped or uploaded smartphone specs and reviews, with workflows for approval and rejection.
acceptance_criteria: Given a scraped smartphone data entry, when content operations user accesses the admin-forge page, then they can view all relevant fields for review
Given any inconsistencies or outdated info, content operations user can edit fields before approval
When content operations user approves data, then the data is marked as verified and published to the platform
When content operations user rejects data, then it does not get published and is flagged for further investigation
Audit logs are kept for all edits and approvals
sprint_stories.rationale: Ensuring data quality and accuracy is critical for trustworthy user experience and platform credibility.

sprint_stories.title: As a user, I want to browse categorized and filterable smartphone listings so that I can find phones by brand, specs, and popularity easily
sprint_stories.description: Implement the smartphone listings page with category filters (brand, specs, popularity), pagination, and sorting options based on completed directory pages and bottom links.
acceptance_criteria: Given the listings page, when user selects a brand filter, then only smartphones of that brand are displayed
Given multiple filters applied, when user changes filters, then the listings update accordingly
Listings support pagination with 20 items per page
Sorting options include price, popularity, and release date
Listings display essential specs and thumbnail images
sprint_stories.rationale: Browsing listings is a core user journey to discover smartphones and is foundational for MVP.

sprint_stories.title: As a user, I want to submit, edit, and delete smartphone reviews so that I can share my experience and help others
sprint_stories.description: Implement user review CRUD (create, read, update, delete) functionality on individual smartphone pages with moderation workflow integration.
acceptance_criteria: Given a logged-in user, when they submit a review with rating and text, then the review is saved and pending moderation
Given a user’s own review, when they edit or delete it, then changes are tracked and updated accordingly
Reviews pending moderation are not shown publicly
Moderators can approve or reject reviews via admin dashboard
Aggregated ratings on smartphone pages update dynamically with approved reviews
sprint_stories.rationale: User-generated reviews are key engagement features and drive trust, enhancing user retention.

sprint_stories.title: As a user, I want a powerful search with autocomplete and filters so that I can quickly find specific smartphones
sprint_stories.description: Improve and finalize search capabilities including autocomplete suggestions, filter options, and sorting, leveraging the typesense collection created.
acceptance_criteria: Given the search input, when user types at least 3 characters, then autocomplete suggestions appear
When user applies filters (brand, specs), then search results update accordingly
Search results are ranked by relevance and popularity
Search supports typo tolerance and synonyms
Search latency is under 300ms
sprint_stories.rationale: Efficient search is vital for user satisfaction and is a foundational platform capability.

sprint_stories.title: As a content manager, I want automated scraping pipelines for major manufacturers to keep smartphone data up to date
sprint_stories.description: Implement and stabilize automated scrapers for Apple, OnePlus, and Samsung smartphone data and review aggregation, ensuring reliability and scheduling.
acceptance_criteria: Scrapers run automatically on schedule without manual intervention
New smartphone releases and updated specs are fetched and stored correctly
Errors and data inconsistencies trigger alerts for content ops
Scraped reviews from multiple sources enrich product pages
Scrapers comply with data privacy and robot.txt policies
sprint_stories.rationale: Automated data collection ensures platform freshness, a core value proposition.

sprint_stories.title: As a platform owner, I want SEO enhancements including sitemap management and landing page metadata so that organic search traffic improves
sprint_stories.description: Develop SEO features such as sitemap generation for listings and retailers, and auto-generation of metadata tags for landing pages targeting key smartphone categories.
acceptance_criteria: Sitemaps are generated and updated automatically daily
Landing pages include meta title, description, and keywords aligned with targeted categories
SEO changes are verified using tools like Google Search Console
Internal linking improvements (bottom links) are implemented to boost crawlability
No broken links or sitemap errors are present
sprint_stories.rationale: SEO is important for long-term user acquisition and platform visibility.

sprint_stories.title: As a user, I want to view aggregated ratings on smartphone pages so that I can quickly assess product quality
sprint_stories.description: Implement aggregated rating display on individual smartphone pages reflecting average user review scores and counts.
acceptance_criteria: Aggregated ratings are calculated from all approved user reviews
Rating display includes average score and total number of reviews
Ratings update dynamically when new reviews are approved
Ratings are prominently visible on the smartphone page above the fold
Rating calculation excludes rejected or flagged reviews
sprint_stories.rationale: Ratings help users make quick decisions and enhance trust on product pages.

sprint_stories.title: As a platform admin, I want a basic admin dashboard for content management, user moderation, and analytics review
sprint_stories.description: Create an admin dashboard prototype that combines content operations tools, user review moderation, and basic analytics overview for initial MVP.
acceptance_criteria: Admin dashboard accessible only to authorized users
Includes sections for content approval, user review moderation, and key usage metrics
Allows filtering and searching of content items and reviews for moderation
Dashboard UI is responsive and usable on desktop
Audit logs and moderation actions are recorded
sprint_stories.rationale: Admin capabilities are essential for maintaining platform quality and compliance.

sprint_stories.title: As a user, I want to compare smartphone models side-by-side so that I can make informed purchasing decisions
sprint_stories.description: Develop a basic comparison feature allowing users to select up to 3 smartphone models and view their specs side-by-side in a clean, easy-to-read UI.
acceptance_criteria: Users can add up to 3 smartphones to compare from listing or product pages
Comparison shows key specs such as display, processor, camera, battery, and price
Comparison UI is responsive and easy to navigate
Users can remove phones from comparison dynamically
Comparison data is accurate and reflects latest specs
sprint_stories.rationale: Comparison is a core differentiator for user decision making and engagement.

sprint_stories.title: As a platform owner, I want affiliate tracking integrated with dynamic pricing updates so that revenue attribution is accurate
sprint_stories.description: Integrate affiliate tracking mechanisms into retailer price update flows, ensuring clicks and conversions are tracked correctly alongside live price and stock info.
acceptance_criteria: Affiliate tracking codes are appended to retailer links
Price and stock data update dynamically from retailer APIs
Affiliate clicks and conversions are logged and reportable
Tracking does not degrade page load performance
Affiliate integration complies with privacy and data regulations
sprint_stories.rationale: Affiliate revenue is a key monetization strategy and must be implemented early.

sprint_goal: Deliver core MVP features for smartphone listings, user reviews, and basic SEO to enable initial platform launch and user engagement.
rationale: Generated based on PRD and JIRA context
risk_assessment: Key risks include dependency on external data sources (scraping and retailer APIs) which may cause delays or data inaccuracies; mitigation involves close monitoring, alerting, and fallback manual workflows. Integration complexity for admin and review moderation features may impact timeline; early prototyping and incremental delivery recommended. SEO improvements may require coordination with marketing team to align keywords and content strategy. The 43 story points slightly exceed typical sprint capacity; prioritization or scope adjustment may be required.
recommendations: Prioritize stories critical to MVP launch: admin-forge interface, smartphone listings, user reviews, search, and scraping automation.
Defer lower priority or lower complexity stories (like affiliate tracking and admin dashboard prototype) if velocity constraints arise.
Conduct daily scrums to monitor external data dependencies and unblock scraping or API issues quickly.
Plan for additional QA focus on data accuracy due to reliance on automated scraping and manual content operations.
Engage marketing early to validate SEO metadata and sitemap requirements.
